intro: Thaspium sylvaticum, commonly known as the common thaspium, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant has a fibrous root system. Thaspium sylvaticum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
